29 May 2014 ~ Candace Faber

Fast Company Covers #H2EH Projects

As many of our teams continue their important work together, their projects are getting well-deserved coverage in major outlets. It turns out, national media are as motivated to understand, demystify, and solve homelessness as we are!

06 May 2014 ~ Candace Faber

Project Reports Are Up!

Hey everyone! We hope you noticed our new "Completed Projects" tab, which features your slide decks and all your names. We want to make sure all of you get credit for the amazing work you did this weekend.

06 May 2014 ~ Candace Faber

Give BIG!

Today is the Seattle Foundation's Give BIG campaign! The Foundation will amplify gifts made today with its matching pool, and each hour, one donor will win a $1000 raffle ticket. It's a good day to make a difference!

We are working to get all the projects showcased on the home page, but in the meantime, we thought you would enjoy seeing a roundup of our media coverage. Come See What We've Built

Hey everybody! Just wanted to let you know we have about 45 tickets still available for tonight's finale. Our teams have been working on some incredible stuff -- everything from an app for data collection about street homelessness to a social network for low-end mobile phones. We are excited to start working with our data and pitching in on projects with our partners! Follow us today on Twitter at @hack2end for live updates and photos.

Hack to End Homelessness featured in GeekWire!

Read Taylor Soper's report, "Can Technology Solve Homelessness?" which features the Hack to End Homelessness team and other Seattle-area entrepreneurs, including from Impact Hub Seattle.
